intro: Acrostichum barbatum, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, and it is also cultivated for ornamental purposes. The species is known for its ability to tolerate saltwater, making it a common sight in coastal areas.
